doc:
Henry Morgan (humorist) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Morgan_(humorist) 0 Henry Morgan (born Henry Lerner Van Ost Jr.; March 31, 1915 – May 19, 1994) was an American humorist. He first became familiar to radio audiences in the 1930s and 1940s as a barbed but often self-deprecating satirist; in the 1950s and later, he was a regular and cantankerous panelist on the game show I've Got a Secret as well as other game and talk shows. Morgan was a second cousin of Broadway lyricist and librettist Alan Jay Lerner. Henry_Morgan ( born Henry_Lerner_Van_Ost_Jr. ; March_31_,_1915 – May_19_,_1994 ) was an_American_humorist . He first became familiar to radio_audiences in the_1930s_and_1940s as a_barbed_but_often_self-deprecating_satirist ; in the_1950s_and later , he was a_regular_and_cantankerous_panelist on the_game_show I 've_Got a_Secret as_well as other_game_and_talk_shows . Morgan was a_second_cousin of Broadway_lyricist_and_librettist_Alan_Jay_Lerner .
